body.p:
Owingsville Ky
March 22nd 1864.
His Excellency
The Gov of Ky

Some time since a petition, signed by many of our best, citizens asking you to remit, a fine of $50 00 imposed upon John Teal, at the March term 1862 of the Bath Circuit Court ^for selling Liquor to a minor^ was sent you

Permit us again to ask you to remit, the fine on the following grounds. Said Teal has but one arm, his right one being off just below the shoulder he is a small wakly man about fifty years of age has a wife and Eight children living, his wife is in bad health and unable to do anything he has no property whatever save, a little, plunder in his house. and it is all he can do to, find and clothe his family in the most humble manner and he actually cannot pay said fine. We think if there ever was a case in which the, Gov ought to pardon this in one, and do earnestly hope he will do so,

Respectfully
George Tay
Wm Richards
N. N. King
R. Couthard
Jas F Maury
